attributes.action: Call a General Election due to the Conservative Gov’s inability to unify.
attributes.additional_details:
It is commonly believed that Brexit and the negotiations as they have played out have largely been to quell and resolve divisions within a divided Conservative party.

Whether true or not, talks have for the most part been unsuccessful in unifying a divided party. With so much infighting the party may now be incapable of leading the country in a coherent fashion and therefore a General Election should be called at the earliest opportunity to establish a working government.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party are thought by some to have served their own party interests before that of the country re: Brexit. Some believe this to be an abandonment of ministerial responsibility. It is possible their government is no longer legitimate and should be confirmed in a GE.
